Has all the features you need in a pretty and practical user interface.

It's a powerfully, stable and beautiful torrent manager. I can use on all my computers (multiple OS's), and I never missed uTorrent(bloatware), Transmission(way to simple), Delugue(problems on windows). 10/10
I've tried a load of different clients, but this is the one you want. Rock solid programme. A+
Fast, smooth, lightweight.
1min on duckduckgo and learn how to set it up properly, add a blocklist. Best torrent manager available.
This application quickly downloads files (against Transmission), without ads (against uTorrent), and, in my opinion, is convenient.
The best torrent client ever, specially file browsing, very convinient.

Written in C++ and QT for the GUI means this program runs fast with little over-head and resources as an app like this should be. It's cross platform, open source and ad free!

It's full featured just as uTorrent but without all the sleaze like adverts and getting caught mining Bitcoin on users computers. 

In conclusion, qBittorrent should be the defacto standard if you're looking for more power than Transmission offers.
summary: Exactly what you need for more power

description: It works great! The best thing about this torrent client is that it never pops up any ads or anything messy without your permission.

Great torrent features with libtorrent-rasterbar. Very nice and polished interface made in Qt. Of course draws some Qt dependencies if you are on Gnome/GTK, but well worth it. Overall, an order of magnitude easier than Transmission.
Does as good as all one could need from a GUI torrent client. especially when using search engine plugins that can be found online.

Force re-check for torrents just sucks. If you've changed file's directory, use automatic rules or whatever. And also it totally dishonoring speed limits for single torrent as global ones. With downloading limits, with uploading limits, with uTP connection limits, whatever!
Verdict? 5 stars for awesome ideas in torrent management and clean gui, but 1 star for pure realization and very unstable speeds. It just didn't do well what it must do.

description:
1.) To free up space on my NAS I deleted a hundred gigs or so of old files
2.) On next startup, qbittorrent rechecked and redownloaded all of them
3.) I deleted the files from qbittorrent this time
4.) All of the same files re-downloaded AGAIN from RSS since that's where they came from in the first place.

All in all, it was extremely obnoxious.

No ads, light weight, highly customizable.
Literally the best out of them all.

Qbitorrent est français, il s'agit simplement de la version open-source de uTorrent, à ma connaissance, c'est le plus fiable avec Transmission, ajouter à cela plus de fonctionnalités et toujours garanti sans pubs, inutile d'aller voir ailleurs.
Avec ça on est tout de suite dénoncé à Adopi. C'est ce qui m'est arrivé les deux seules fois où je l'ai utilisée.

Qbittorrent est libre (=Open Source), on peut y trouver beaucoup de fichiers rares en y installant des greffons ici:

https://github.com/qbittorrent/search-plugins/wiki/Unofficial-search-plugins
